text: sim_wL, sim_wA, sim_wB weights three channels. keep balance consistent human perception. quantity colorradius adjusts number clusters, value low, number targets increase, leads detailed segmentation results. adjust_centroids_and_return_masks parameter set FALSE output kmeans_image_data RGB image, otherwise black--white image. colour_type parameter: RGB (Red-Green-Blue), LAB (Lightness, -colour-dimension, B-colour-dimension) HSV (Hue, Saturation, Value) colour. Higher resolution images give better results. affinity propagation algorithm used default parameter values. setting sim_normalize parameter TRUE, affinity propagation algorithm requires less iterations complete. However, colorradius parameter effect similarity matrix normalized. Regarding use_median parameter Rcpp use following steps: 1st. compute superpixels extract labels, 2nd. superpixel label consists multiple pixels superpixels compute dissimilarity matrix therefore superpixel must correspond single value, 3rd. come single value superpixel R user option either use 'mean' 'median multiple image pixels (per superpixel) —————kmeans initializers———————- optimal_init   : initializer adds rows data incrementally, checking already exist centroid-matrix quantile_init  : initialization centroids using cummulative distance observations removing potential duplicates kmeans++       : kmeans++ initialization. Reference : http://theory.stanford.edu/~sergei/papers/kMeansPP-soda.pdf http://stackoverflow.com/questions/5466323/-exactly--k-means-work random         : random selection data rows initial centroids

TRUE affinity propagation image data computed returned use_median boolean. TRUE median used rather mean value inner computations (see details section information) minib_kmeans_batch size mini batches minib_kmeans_init_fraction percentage data use initialization centroids (applies initializer kmeans++ optimal_init). float number 0.0 1.0. kmeans_num_init number times algorithm run different centroid seeds kmeans_max_iters maximum number clustering iterations kmeans_initializer method initialization. One , optimal_init, quantile_init, kmeans++ random. See details information colour_type character string specifying colour type. can one "RGB", "LAB" "HSV" compactness_factor numeric value specifying compactness parameter case method "slic" adjust_centroids_and_return_masks boolean. TRUE kmeans_method parameter empty ("") centroids adjusted image-masks returned. allow plot masks using spixel_masks_show method. return_labels_2_dimensionsional boolean. TRUE matrix labels based output superpixels combination Affinity Propagation clusters returned sim_normalize boolean. TRUE constructed similarity matrix normalised unit p-norm (see armadillo documentation details) sim_wL numeric value specifying weight "L" channel image (see details section information) sim_wA numeric value specifying weight "" channel image (see details section information) sim_wB numeric value specifying weight "B" channel image (see details section information) sim_color_radius numeric value specifying colorradius (see details section information) ap_maxits numeric value specifying maximum number iterations Affinity Propagation Clustering (defaults 1000) ap_convits numeric value. estimated exemplars stay fixed convits iterations, affinity propagation algorithm terminates early (defaults 100) ap_dampfact float number specifying update equation damping level [0.5, 1). Higher values correspond heavy damping, may needed oscillations occur Affinity Propagation Clustering (defaults 0.9) ap_nonoise float number. affinity propagation algorithm adds small amount noise data prevent degenerate cases; disables . verbose boolean. code: library(SuperpixelImageSegmentation)  path = system.file("images", "BSR_bsds500_image.jpg", package = "SuperpixelImageSegmentation")  im = OpenImageR::readImage(path)  init = Image_Segmentation$new()  num_spix = 10           # for illustration purposes # num_spix = 600        # recommended number of superpixels  spx = init$spixel_segmentation(input_image = im,                                superpixel = num_spix,                                AP_data = TRUE,                                use_median = TRUE,                                return_labels_2_dimensionsional = TRUE,                                sim_color_radius = 10) #> Warning: The input data has values between 0.000000 and 1.000000. The image-data will be multiplied by the value: 255!   #........................... # plot the superpixel labels #...........................  plt = init$spixel_clusters_show(spix_labels = spx$spix_labels,                                 color_palette = grDevices::rainbow,                                 parameter_list_png = NULL)  # plt   #.................................................... # create a binary image for a specified cluster label #....................................................  pix_values = spx$spix_labels  target_cluster = 3                               # determine clusters visually ('plt' variable)  pix_values[pix_values != target_cluster] = 0     # set all other values to 0 (background) pix_values[pix_values == target_cluster] = 1     # set the target_cluster to 1 (binary image)  # OpenImageR::imageShow(pix_values)
